page.title: 17RELIGION - 1
page.content: The area was originally known as the Ancient Chapelry of Escomb, which dates back to the 7th. century, and was not covered by Domesday records. Two Churches, the Saxon Church in Escomb and St. Paul's in Witton Park serve the area. By tradition, more servicess are held at St. Pauls and the vicar has served as Chaplain to the Bishop of Durham. Community life in the area is slowly being rebuilt having centered in the past on the Coalmines and Brickworks. These are now closed and the Church serves a largely unemployed but vigorous, independent population. Since 1981 Church attendance has risen by about 10% and about 190 attend the Saxon Church, and 288 St. Paul's each month. This is about 5% of the population. About 80 children attend the Sunday School each month.
